siteMetadata.title: Carson Covell
siteMetadata.description: Carson Covell is a web developer living in Atlanta, GA.

markdownRemark.html:
I look at my watch, it reads 5:55pm. Whew, I made it on time. I enter the room and am greeted by five smiling students all eager for help on their website. They have spent the last ten weeks learning HTML, CSS and little JavaScript. I take a look at their websites. Wow! They have come so far, I think to myself. This is their last Refugee Coding class.

The Refugee Coding class, or RefCode, is a ten week coding class for refugees in Clarkston, GA. Over the course of the ten weeks, the students are taught the basics of web development and as well as standard software development practices like agile methodology and Github.

The program was started two years ago by Brenton Strine and is part of the Friends of Refugees non-profit organization.

RefCode was my first time venturing into the world of teaching web development, and I'm surprised by how challenging it is.
